creator: sprior@geekster.com
text:
The following page will not compile:
<%@ page import="org.omg.CORBA.*" %>
<HTML>
<BODY>
Hi there
</BODY>
</HTML>
==============================================
...\foo_jsp.java:27: reference to Object is ambiguous, both class
org.omg.CORBA.Object in org.omg.CORBA and class java.lang.Object in java.lang match
    [javac]     Object page = this;
==============================================
  public void _jspService(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response)
  .....
    Object page = this;
================================================
Here's a fix:
    java.lang.Object page = this;

Just make the generator produce less ambiguous code for this line.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
There have been a number of reports of problems of a similar nature to this. 
The standard response has been WONTFIX.

The work around is:
- don't use * in imports, just import the classes you need
- if you do need to use a class that clashes (such as org.omg.CORBA.Object) 
refer to it as org.omg.CORBA.Object in your JSP.
